transcript.text: Noam Chomsky born 1928 as an American
public intellectual a linguist
philosopher cognitive scientist
historian social critic and political
activist
the father of modern Linguistics Chomsky
is a major figure in analytic philosophy
and one of the founders of the field of
cognitive science chomsky's linguistic
Theory lies in biolinguistics a school
of thought which holds that the
structures of language are biologically
preset in the human mind and are
genetically inherited one of the most
cited Scholars alive chomsky's ideas are
highly influential in the
anti-capitalist and Anti-Imperialist
movements and he remains a leading
critic of U.S foreign policy
contemporary State capitalism and the
U.S and Israel's role in the
israeli-palestinian conflict
Chomsky believes that World War II is
the only Justified War the U.S has
fought in his lifetime arguing that the
basic principle of U.S foreign policy is
the establishment of open societies that
are economically and politically
controlled by the United States and
where U.S based businesses can prosper
